newsitem.title: FRANCE: Iraq buys at least 150,000 tns HRW wheat near $194.
newsitem.headline: Iraq buys at least 150,000 tns HRW wheat near $194.

text.p: Iraq has bought 150,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat at a delivered price of $194 per tonne, and may have bought another 50,000 tonnes for $193.50 per tonne, European grain traders said on Thursday.
The wheat was bought at a tender specifying July shipment and is part of Iraq's purchases under an oil-for-food pact with the United Nations.
Four companies were involved for 50,000 tonnes each, with three offering at $194 including transport and the other at $193.50 per tonne, traders said.
"Two hundred thousand tonnes has possibly been done but not all of it has necessarily been confirmed by the Iraqis," said one trader.
Iraq had originally been looking for 50,000 tonnes but a drop in world prices may have helped boost the volume, traders said.
